electroreception.notes: Apteronotids are electric fish, using a high frequency tone-type (also called wave-type) electric organ discharge (EOD) to communicate and likely for electrolocation.

vision.notes: These nocturnal fish have small eyes. Given habitat in deep rivers, some species may have reduced reliance on vision.

mechanoreception.notes: Likely important for detecting prey and navigating the environment, especially in benthic foraging species. Inferred based on general fish sensory biology.

chemoreception.notes: Likely used in foraging and social interactions, as in most fish. Assumed based on general fish biology.
